params.extraData: Extra data for use on the client-side.
params.localToken: Address of the token on this domain.
params.remoteToken: Address of the token on the remote domain.
params.tokenId: ID of the specific token deposited.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to L1. Data supplied here will not be used to                     execute any code on L1 and is only emitted as extra data for the                     convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to L1. Data supplied here will not be used to                     execute any code on L1 and is only emitted as extra data for the                     convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.
params._to: Address to receive the token on the other domain.

params._messenger: Address of the CrossDomainMessenger on this network.
params._otherBridge: Address of the ERC721 bridge on the other network.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to L1. Data supplied here will not be used to                     execute any code on L1 and is only emitted as extra data for the                     convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._from: Address that triggered the bridge on the other domain.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 token on this domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 token on the other domain.
params._to: Address to receive the token on this domain.
params._tokenId: ID of the token being deposited.

params._messenger: Address of the CrossDomainMessenger on this network.
params._otherBridge: Address of the ERC721 bridge on the other network.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

ERC721BridgeFailed(address,address,addre.notice: Emitted when an ERC721 bridge from the other network fails.

ERC721BridgeFinalized(address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when an ERC721 bridge from the other network is finalized.

ERC721BridgeInitiated(address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when an ERC721 bridge to the other network is initiated.

bridgeERC721(address,address,uint256,uin.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to the caller's account on L1.

bridgeERC721To(address,address,address,u.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to some recipient's account on L1.

finalizeBridgeERC721(address,address,add.notice: Completes an ERC721 bridge from the other domain and sends the ERC721 token to the         recipient on this domain.

otherBridge().notice: Address of the bridge on the other network.

userdoc.notice: The L2 ERC721 bridge is a contract which works together with the L1 ERC721 bridge to         make it possible to transfer ERC721 tokens between Optimism and Ethereum. This contract         acts as a minter for new tokens when it hears about deposits into the L1 ERC721 bridge.         This contract also acts as a burner for tokens being withdrawn.
